subject: Investing
title: Overreacting to Short-Term News
description: A quick win: understand Overreacting to Short-Term News.

hook.text: A company missed earnings by one penny. Its stock dropped 8% in a day, then recovered within a week.

buildup.text: Markets often overreact to short-term news, swinging far beyond what fundamentals justify.

discovery.text: Studies show that post-earnings price swings reverse partially within days as cooler heads prevail.

twist.text: Algorithmic trading amplifies overreaction. Machines sell on headlines faster than humans can read them.

climax.text: Long-term investors who ignore daily noise outperform those who react to every data point.

punchline.text: Zoom out. The signal lives in years, not in minutes.

quiz.question: How do markets typically behave after short-term overreactions?
